msgSnippet: Siju, I have yet to see a NoClassDefFoundError that has not been a result of the class not being in the classpath for some reason or other.  Can you show us

Siju,

I have yet to see a NoClassDefFoundError that has not
been a result of the class not being in the classpath
for some reason or other.  Can you show us where your
server has the jar that contains
junit.htmlui.TestServletBase in its classpath?

--
Erik Meade             emeade@...
Senior Consultant      Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org 
 

> -----Original Message-----
> From: siju paul [mailto:hisiju@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2001 11:24 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] weblogic
> 
> 
> 
> I'm using Weblogic 5.1 server and i want to test my
> EJBs.
> 
> I'm also using JUnitEE.
> I have put both JUnit.jar and JUnitEE.jar
> But when I run my server and call the Test Servlet,
> the server gives NoClassDefFoundError :
> junit/htmlui/TestServletBase.
> 
> What might be the problem?
> 
> Siju.
subject: RE: [junit] weblogic
